snippet: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq reduced his cabinet to just 22 members as part of an overhaul in response to protests against corruption and poor governance.
abstract: Iraq's Prime Min Haider al-Abadi continues to reshape his government in face of public outcry over political dysfunction and graft, cutting his cabinet to 22 members from 33.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq reduced his cabinet to just 22 members as part of an overhaul in response to protests against corruption and poor governance.

headline.main: Iraqi Leader’s Overhaul Cuts 11 Cabinet Positions
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Leader’s Overhaul Cuts 11 Cabinet Positions
